Virtual Networks

A private network in the cloud that can be easily expanded to local networks through site-to-site VPNs.

Apply for trial Purchase now

Virtual networks in Azure are free of charge. Every subscription permits building at most 50 virtual networks across all regions.

The public IP address and retained IP address used by services in the virtual network are charged.

The network devices running in the virtual network, including VPN gateway and application gateway, are also charged.

Virtual Network Peering (VNET Peering)

VNET Peering (VNET Peering) connects two virtual networks in the same region, allowing you to transmit traffic between two networks through a special IP address. You may subscribe and use VNET Peering across regions.

Metering Pricing
Incoming Data Transmission ¥0.06572 /GB
Outgoing Data Transmission ¥0.06572 /GB

IP Address

The public IP address and retained IP address could be applied to services running in the virtual network. The IP Address Pricing Details page lists the standard fees of these IP addresses.

VPN Gateway

The virtual network may have one or several VPN gateways of local network or other virtual networks connecting back to Azure.

For the charging standards for VPN Gateway, see the VPN Gateway Pricing Details page.

Support and Service Level Agreements

If you have any questions or need any help, please access Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

The virtual network is free of charge and a service level agreement isn’t provided. If you want to learn more about the details of our server level agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreement page.
